section.name: UNIT 3: EXPLORING THE SCIENTIFIC PRACTICES
section.summary:
Welcome to Unit 3: Exploring the Scientific Practices.

In June 2012, the National Research Council (NRC) released a report, A Framework for K–12 Science Education: Practices, Crosscutting Concepts, and Core Ideas, to provide new direction on standards for science education. Although the report focuses on K–12, there are implications and takeaways for the way we teach adults in ABE/ASE.

This unit provides an overview of each of the scientific practices described in the report and explores ways adults in ABE/ASE can use them in everyday life scenarios.

After completing this unit, you will be able to

  • define scientific practice and identify the eight scientific practices,
  • compare and contrast the scientific practices and the scientific method approaches to science instruction, and
  • match the scientific practices to descriptions of their use in everyday life scenarios.

Please allow approximately 45 minutes to complete this unit. However, you are free to leave the unit at any time.
